contentrichtext.text: A '''flat ride''' is a type of [[amusement ride]]. Historically, the term has been associated with pancake-shaped rides, such as [[carousel]]s, that are on the ground and easy to dismantle.<ref name="Popular Science">{{cite journal|last=Brown|first=Reynold|date=July 1949|journal=Popular Science|publisher=Bonnier Corporation|volume=155|page=84|issn=0161-7370|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=iyQDAAAAMBAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref> Many attractions at [[traveling carnival]]s are considered flat rides. The term has also been used to describe modern rides, such as [[drop tower]] and [[Pirate ship (ride)|swinging ship]] rides.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Applegate|first1=Harry|last2=Benton|first2=Thomas|title=Six Flags Great Adventure|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=xlMzY_jZEpMC&dq=%22flat+ride%22&source=gbs_navlinks_s|year=2009|publisher=Arcadia Publishing|isbn=978-0-7385-6569-9}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Amusement rides by type]] {{amusement-ride-stub}}
